style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">23</span></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"></hr><div><a id="sf1f205e8b00c4e848fe29f9e54c1192f"></a></div><div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><a style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;" href="#s566B28AC7F4D55EC973F7457E5A47EAB"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">Table of Contents</span></a></div></div><div><br/></div><ix:nonNumeric contextRef="FD2020Q3YTD" name="us-gaap:SubsequentEventsTextBlock" id="TextSelection-0BA064B0D203CF88A2DEF1003AD3BA15-0-wk-Fact-0809A4F6688ECDE7E7CFF101D270D590" escape="true"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">Note 19 - Subsequent Events</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;"> </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">On December 19, 2019, we entered into a definitive agreement to acquire Drybar Products LLC, which includes the Drybar trademark and other intellectual property assets associated with Drybar&#8217;s products, as well as certain related production assets and working capital.  As part of the transaction, we will grant a worldwide license to Drybar Holdings LLC, the owner and long-time operator of Drybar blowout salons, to use the Drybar trademark in their continued operation of Drybar salons.  The salons will exclusively use, promote, and sell Helen of Troy&#8217;s Drybar products globally.  The total purchase consideration is </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d20545293e536-wk-Fact-FDF163CF163BDC0E3C0166B594736AB1" name="us-gaap:BusinessCombinationConsiderationTransferred1" contextRef="D2020Q4_us-gaap_BusinessAcquisitionAxis_hele_DrybarProductsLLCMember_us-gaap_StatementScenarioAxis_us-gaap_ScenarioForecastMember_us-gaap_SubsequentEventTypeAxis_us-gaap_SubsequentEventMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">255.0</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> in cash, subject to certain customary closing adjustments.  We expect to finance the acquisition with cash on hand and borrowings from our existing revolving credit facility.  The acquisition is expected to close by January 31, 2020, subject to customary closing conditions, including regulatory approvals.</span></div></ix:nonNumeric><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"><br/></span></div><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">24</span></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"></hr><div><a id="s08E891FF565D574F9221AECCB835E836"></a></div><div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><a style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;" href="#s566B28AC7F4D55EC973F7457E5A47EAB"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">Table of Contents</span></a></div></div><div><br/></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">ITEM&#160;2.&#160;&#160;&#160;MANAGEMENT&#8217;S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;">This Management&#8217;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations (&#8220;MD&amp;A&#8221;) contains a number of forward-looking statements, all of which are based on current expectations.  Actual results may differ materially due to a number of factors, including those discussed in Part I, Item 3 of this report. &#8220;Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures about Market Risk&#8221; and &#8220;Information Regarding Forward-Looking Statements&#8221; in this report and &#8220;Risk Factors&#8221; in the Company&#8217;s most recent annual report on Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended February 28, 2019 (&#8220;Form 10-K&#8221;) and its other filings with the Securities and Exchange Commission (the &#8220;SEC&#8221;).  This discussion should be read in conjunction with our condensed consolidated financial statements included under Part I, Item 1 of this report.  When used in the MD&amp;A, unless otherwise indicated or the context suggests otherwise, references to &#8220;the Company&#8221;, &#8220;our Company&#8221;, &#8220;Helen of Troy&#8221;, &#8220;we&#8221;, &#8220;us&#8221;, or &#8220;our&#8221; refer to Helen of Troy Limited and its subsidiaries.  Throughout MD&amp;A, we refer to our Leadership Brands, which are brands that have number-one and number-two positions in their respective categories and consist of the OXO, Honeywell, Braun, PUR, Hydro Flask, Vicks, and Hot Tools brands.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">&#160;</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">This MD&amp;A, including the tables under the headings &#8220;Operating income, operating margin, adjusted operating income (non-GAAP) and adjusted operating margin (non-GAAP) by segment" and &#8220;Income from continuing operations, diluted earnings per share ("EPS") from continuing operations, adjusted income from continuing operations (non-GAAP), and adjusted diluted EPS from continuing operations (non-GAAP),&#8221; respectively, reports operating income, operating margin, income from continuing operations and diluted EPS from continuing operations without the impact of non-cash asset impairment charges, acquisition-related expenses, restructuring charges, amortization of intangible assets, and non-cash share-based compensation for the periods presented, as applicable.  These measures may be considered non-GAAP financial information as set forth in SEC Regulation G, Rule 100.  The tables reconcile these measures to their corresponding GAAP-based measures presented in our condensed consolidated statements of income.  We believe that adjusted operating income, adjusted operating margin, adjusted income from continuing operations, and adjusted diluted EPS from continuing operations provide useful information to management and investors regarding financial and business trends relating to our financial condition and results of operations.  We believe that these non-GAAP financial measures, in combination with our financial results calculated in accordance with GAAP, provide investors with additional perspective regarding the impact of such charges on applicable income, margin and earnings per share measures.  We also believe that these non-GAAP measures facilitate a more direct comparison of our performance to our competitors.  We further believe that including the excluded charges would not accurately reflect the underlying performance of our continuing operations for the period in which the charges are incurred, even though such charges may be incurred and reflected in our GAAP financial results in the near future.  The material limitation associated with the use of the non-GAAP financial measures is that the non-GAAP measures do not reflect the full economic impact of our activities.  Our adjusted operating income, adjusted operating margin, adjusted income from continuing operations, and adjusted diluted EPS from continuing operations are not prepared in accordance with GAAP, are not an alternative to GAAP financial information and may be calculated differently than non-GAAP financial information disclosed by other companies.  Accordingly, undue reliance should not be placed on non-GAAP information.  </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">These measures are discussed further and reconciled to their applicable GAAP based measures contained in this MD&amp;A beginning on page 36.&#160;</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">25</span></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"></hr><div><a id="s0363515D59D9533E838B379A3FDB6654"></a></div><div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><a style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;" href="#s566B28AC7F4D55EC973F7457E5A47EAB"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">Table of Contents</span></a></div></div><div><br/></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">OVERVIEW</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">We incorporated as Helen of Troy Corporation in Texas in 1968 and were reorganized as Helen of Troy Limited in Bermuda in 1994.&#160;&#160;We are a leading global consumer products company offering creative products and solutions for our customers through a diversified portfolio of well-recognized and widely-trusted brands.&#160;&#160;We have built leading market positions through new product innovation, product quality and competitive pricing.&#160;&#160;We currently operate in three segments consisting of Housewares, Health &amp; Home, and Beauty.&#160;&#160;</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">In fiscal 2015, we launched a five-year transformational strategy designed to improve the performance of our business segments and strengthen our shared service capabilities.&#160; Fiscal 2019 marked the completion of Phase I of our multi-year transformation strategy, which delivered performance across a wide range of measures.  We improved core sales growth by focusing on our Leadership Brands, made strategic acquisitions, became a more efficient operating company with strong global shared services, upgraded our organization and culture, improved inventory turns and return on invested capital, and returned capital to shareholders. </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">Fiscal 2020 began Phase II of our transformation and is designed to drive the next five years of progress.  The long-term objectives of Phase II include improved organic sales growth, continued margin expansion, and strategic and effective capital deployment.  We expect Phase II will include continued investment in our Leadership Brands, with a focus on growing them through consumer-centric innovation, expanding them more aggressively outside the United States, and adding new brands through acquisition.  We anticipate building further shared service capability and operating efficiency, as well as attracting, retaining, unifying and training the best people. </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">On December 19, 2019, we entered into a definitive agreement to acquire Drybar Products LLC, which includes the Drybar trademark and other intellectual property assets associated with Drybar&#8217;s products, as well as certain related production assets and working capital.  As part of the transaction, we will grant a worldwide license to Drybar Holdings LLC, the owner and long-time operator of Drybar blowout salons, to use the Drybar trademark in their continued operation of Drybar salons.  The salons will exclusively use, promote, and sell Helen of Troy&#8217;s Drybar products globally.  The total cash consideration is $255.0 million, subject to certain customary closing adjustments. We expect to finance the acquisition with cash on hand and borrowings from our existing revolving credit facility.  The acquisition is expected to close by January 31, 2020, subject to customary closing conditions, including regulatory approvals.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:12px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">In fiscal 2018, we announced that we had approved a restructuring plan (&#8220;Project Refuel&#8221;).  Project Refuel includes a reduction-in-force and the elimination of certain contracts and operating expenses.  We are targeting total annualized profit improvements of approximately </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">$8.0</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> to </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">$10.0 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> over the duration of the plan.&#160; We estimate the plan will be completed during fiscal 2020, and expect to incur total restructuring charges of approximately $7.0 million over the duration of the plan.  Since implementing Project Refuel, we have incurred </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">$6.5 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> of pre-tax restructuring costs as of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">November 30, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">.  For additional information regarding Project Refuel, see </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">Note 10</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> to the accompanying condensed consolidated financial statements.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">In December 2017, we completed the divestiture of the Nutritional Supplements segment through the sale of Healthy Directions LLC and its subsidiaries ("Healthy Directions") to Direct Digital, LLC.  The purchase price from the sale was comprised of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">$46.0</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> million in cash, which was paid at closing, and a supplemental payment with a target value of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">$25.0</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> million, payable on or before August 1, 2019.  The final amount of the supplemental payment was adjusted based on a settlement with respect to the calculation of the performance of Healthy Directions through February 28, 2018.  During fiscal 2019, we reduced the estimated value of the supplemental payment to </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">$10.8</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> million and recorded a corresponding pre-tax charge of $5.8 million ($4.4 million after tax) to discontinued operations.  The supplemental payment of $10.8 million was received during the second quarter of fiscal 2020.  Also, during fiscal 2019, </span></div><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">26</span></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"></hr><div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><a style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;" href="#s566B28AC7F4D55EC973F7457E5A47EAB"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">Table of Contents</span></a></div></div><div><br/></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">we recorded an additional charge of $1.5 million ($1.3 million after tax) to discontinued operations, resulting from the resolution of certain contingencies.  In conjunction with the sale of the business, we provided certain transition services that ceased during the second quarter of fiscal 2020.  Following the sale, we no longer consolidate our former Nutritional Supplements segment's operating results.  Unless otherwise indicated, all results presented are from continuing operations. </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"><br/></span></div><div><a id="s3D7ACD3081BD57BF9F428D3DD138F2A8"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">Significant Trends Impacting the Business</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;">&#160;</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Impact of Tariffs</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">During fiscal years 2019 and 2020, the Office of the U.S. Trade Representative (&#8216;&#8216;USTR&#8217;&#8217;) has imposed, and in certain cases subsequently reduced or removed, additional tariffs on products imported from China.  We purchase a high concentration of our products from unaffiliated manufacturers located in China.  This concentration exposes us to risks associated with doing business globally, including changes in tariffs.  </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">The tariff increases that have been implemented by the USTR began to impact our cost of goods sold in the third quarter of fiscal 2019 and will continue to do so, as long as these tariff increases remain in effect.  In December 2019, the U.S. and China announced an interim trade agreement to halt additional tariff increases that were due to become effective before the end of the year and reverse some tariff increases that became effective in September 2019.  The specific details of the interim trade agreement are unclear, as is the ultimate outcome of the broader trade negotiations.  At this time, we expect to mitigate the impact of tariff increases primarily through pricing actions and product cost reductions in our supply chain.  Although our pricing actions are intended to offset the gross profit dollar impact of tariff increases, there are no assurances that the pricing actions will be successful in fully offsetting this impact or will not reduce retail consumption or customer orders in the short-term. </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:12px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">Since July 2018, the USTR has periodically issued lists of products that are excluded from tariffs on Chinese imports.  Under the USTR exclusion process, companies have the opportunity to seek to have particular products excluded from the tariff lists and apply for a refund. </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Potential Impact of Brexit and Offshore Receipts in Respect of Intangible Property Tax</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">The potential exit of the United Kingdom (the "U.K.") from European Union ("E.U.") membership (commonly referred to as "Brexit") could cause disruptions to and create uncertainty surrounding our business, including affecting our relationships with our existing and future customers, suppliers and employees, which could have an adverse effect on our business, financial results and operations. Negotiations are ongoing to determine the future terms of the U.K.&#8217;s relationship with the E.U., including the terms of trade between the U.K. and the E.U.  The effects of Brexit will depend on any agreements the U.K. makes to retain access to E.U. markets either during a transitional period or more permanently. These measures could potentially disrupt the markets we serve and the tax jurisdictions in which we operate, adversely change tax benefits or liabilities in these or other jurisdictions, and may cause us to lose customers, suppliers, and employees.  In addition, Brexit could lead to legal uncertainty and potentially divergent national laws and regulations as the U.K. determines which E.U. laws to replace or replicate.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">The U.K.&#8217;s Offshore Receipts in respect of Intangible Property ("ORIP") rules were introduced by the Finance Act 2019 and came into effect on April 6, 2019.  Under the ORIP rules, where intangible property ("IP") is held in offshore companies, in a territory with which the U.K. does not have a full double taxation arrangement and the IP is used directly or indirectly to enable, facilitate or promote U.K. sales, income derived from that IP could be subject to a U.K. gross receipts tax at 20% of the gross amounts.  Based on currently available information, we intend to treat this tax as a transactional tax included in operating expenses.  Certain aspects of this legislation and its implementation remain unclear at this time and we expect that additional regulations or guidance may be issued and the accounting treatment of the new tax may be clarified.</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> </span></div><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">27</span></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"></hr><div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><a style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;" href="#s566B28AC7F4D55EC973F7457E5A47EAB"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">Table of Contents</span></a></div></div><div><br/></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">While we do not believe the ORIP tax will have a material adverse impact on our consolidated operating results, we do believe that it could be material to the profitability of our EMEA operating unit.  As a result, the ORIP tax could cause us to evaluate different strategic choices with respect to our EMEA operating unit, including a rationalization of the product portfolio sold in the U.K. or an exit from the market, which could adversely impact our net sales revenue.  </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Foreign Currency Exchange Rate Fluctuations</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">Due to the nature of our operations, we have exposure to the impact of fluctuations in exchange rates from transactions that are denominated in a currency other than our reporting currency (the U.S. Dollar). The most significant currencies affecting our operating results are the British Pound, Euro, Canadian Dollar, and Mexican Peso.&#160;&#160;</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">For the </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">three</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> months ended </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">November 30, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">, changes in foreign currency exchange rates had an unfavorable impact on consolidated U.S. Dollar reported net sales revenue of approximately </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">$2.3 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">, or </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">0.5%</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">, compared to an unfavorable impact of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">$1.8 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">, or </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">0.4%</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> for the same period last year.  For the </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">nine</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> months ended </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">November 30, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">, changes in foreign currency exchange rates had an unfavorable impact on consolidated U.S. dollar reported net sales revenue of approximately </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">$6.8 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">, or </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">0.6%</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">, compared to a favorable impact of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">$1.4 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">, or </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">0.1%</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> for the same period last year.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Consumer Spending and Changes in Shopping Preference</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">s</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">Our business depends upon discretionary consumer demand for most of our products and primarily operates within mature and highly developed consumer markets.  The principal driver of our operating performance is the strength of the U.S. retail economy.  For the three month periods ended November 30, 2019 and 2018, U.S. shipments were approximately </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">80%</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> of our net sales.  For the </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">nine</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> months ended </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">November 30, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> and </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">2018</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">, U.S. shipments were approximately </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">79%</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> and </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">78%</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> of our net sales, respectively.   </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">Additionally, the shift in consumer shopping preferences to online or multichannel shopping experiences has changed the concentration of our sales.  For the </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">three and nine</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> month periods ended </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">November 30, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">, our net sales to retail customers fulfilling end-consumer online orders and online sales directly to consumers comprised approximately </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">24%</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> of our total consolidated net sales revenue, and grew approximately </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">30%</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> and </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">28%</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">, respectively, over the same periods last year.  </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">For the </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">three and nine</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> month periods ended </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">November 30, 2018</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">, our net sales to retail customers fulfilling end-consumer online orders and online sales directly to consumers comprised approximately </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">20%</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> of our total consolidated net sales revenue, and grew approximately </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">9%</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> and </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">25%</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">, respectively, over the same periods last year.  </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">With the continued growth in online sales across the retail landscape, many brick and mortar retailers are aggressively looking for ways to improve their customer delivery capabilities to be able to meet customer expectations.&#160;&#160;As a result, it will become increasingly important for us to leverage our distribution capabilities in order to meet the changing demands of our customers, as well as to increase our online capabilities to support our direct-to-consumer sales channels and online channel sales by our retail customers.&#160;</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Variability of the Cough/Cold/Flu Season</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">Sales in several of our Health &amp; Home segment categories are highly correlated to the severity of winter weather and cough/cold/flu incidence.  In the U.S., the cough/cold/flu season historically runs from November through March, with peak activity normally in January to March.  For the 2018-2019 season, fall and winter weather was generally milder than historical averages and cough/cold/flu incidence was significantly lower than the 2017-2018 season, which was an above average season.  </span></div><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">28</span></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"></hr><div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><a style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;" href="#s566B28AC7F4D55EC973F7457E5A47EAB"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">Table of Contents</span></a></div></div><div><br/></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"><br/></span></div><div><a id="s3E72E0590E9957A3870DA41824E29F5C"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">RESULTS OF OPERATIONS</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">&#160;</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">The following tables provide selected operating data, in U.S. Dollars, as a percentage of net sales</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">revenue, and as a year-over-year percentage change:</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;font-size:10pt;"><div style="padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" net</span></div></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:8pt;"><span style="overflow:hidden;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</span></div></td><td colspan="3" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;font-weight:bold;">% Change</span></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="text-align:center;font-size:8pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;font-weight:bold;">2019</span></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</span></div></td><td colspan="2" style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="text-align:center;font-size:8pt;"><span The three months ended November 30, 2019 included pre-tax acquisition-related expenses of $1.5 million with no comparative expenses for the same period last year.</span></div></td></tr></table><div style="line-height:120%;padding-left:4px;text-align:left;padding-left:48px;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"><br/></span></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:24px;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">&#8226;</span></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">Consolidated adjusted operating income </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">increased</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">27.8%</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">, or </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">$19.7 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">, to </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">$90.3 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> for the </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">three</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> months ended </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">November 30, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">, compared to </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">$70.6 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> for the same period last year. million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">, or </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">24.7%</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">, to </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">$496.0 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">, compared to </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">$397.7 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">.  Growth was primarily driven by a core business increase of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">$99.5 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">, or </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">25.0%</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">, due to:</span></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:24px;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">&#8226;</span></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">point of sale growth and incremental distribution with existing domestic brick and mortar customers; and</span></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:24px;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">&#8226;</span></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">new product introductions.  </span></div></td></tr></table><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">These factors were partially offset by the unfavorable impact of net foreign currency fluctuations of approximately </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">$1.3 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">, or </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">0.3%</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"><br/></span></div><div><a id="sD2811B39AA1551C1B3B2B944C019E069"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:underline;">Health &amp; Home</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;">Comparison of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;">Third</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;"> Quarter Fiscal </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;">2020</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;"> to </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;">Third</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;"> Quarter Fiscal </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;">2019</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">Net sales revenue </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">decreased</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">$2.1 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">, or </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">1.1%</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">, to </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">$185.8 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">, compared to </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">$187.9 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">.  The decline was driven by a core business decline of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">$1.0 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">, or </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">0.5%</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> due to lower domestic sales driven by the unfavorable comparative impact from more wildfire activity in the same period last year and net distribution changes year-over-year.  These factors were partially offset by revenue from new product introductions and growth in international sales. </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-left:48px;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;">Comparison of First </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;">Nine</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;"> Months of Fiscal </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;">2020</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;"> to First </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;">Nine</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;"> Months of Fiscal </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;">2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;"> </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">Net sales revenue </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">decreased</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">$27.5 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">, or </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">5.2%</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">, to </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">$499.5 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> compared to </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">$527.1 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">. </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">4.5%</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">, due to:</span></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> to </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">$67.8 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">, or </span><span million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">, or </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">12.9%</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> of segment net sales, in the same period last year. </span></div><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">38</span></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"></hr><div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span period last year.  The </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">0.3</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> percentage point decrease in segment operating margin was primarily due </span></div></td></tr></table><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">Adjusted operating income </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">increased</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">7.4%</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> to </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">$31.0 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">, or </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">11.5%</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> of segment net sales, compared to </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">$28.9 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">, or </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">11.4%</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> of segment net sales, in the same period last year. </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-left:4px;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div><a id="s0B08C4D2426156A8B0C6C320EB021CD1"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Interest Expense</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">&#160;</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;">Comparison of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;">Third</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;"> Quarter Fiscal </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;">2020</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;"> to </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;">Third</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;"> Quarter Fiscal </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;">2019</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">Interest expense was </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">$2.8 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">, compared to </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">$3.0 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">.  The decrease in interest expense was primarily due to lower average levels of debt outstanding and lower average interest rates. </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;">Comparison of First </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;">Nine</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;"> Months of Fiscal </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;">2020</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;"> to First </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;">Nine</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;"> Months of Fiscal </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;">2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;"> </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">Interest expense was </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">$9.3 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">, compared to </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">$8.4 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">.  The increase in interest expense was primarily due to higher average interest rates. </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"><br/></span></div><div><a id="sD922CA86AE175092B64667CA687D5E55"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Income Tax Expense</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">&#160;</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">The period-over-period comparison of our effective tax rate is impacted by the mix of taxable income in our various tax jurisdictions.  Due to our organization in Bermuda and the ownership structure of our foreign subsidiaries, many of which are not owned directly or indirectly by a U.S. parent company, an immaterial amount of our foreign income is subject to U.S. taxation on a permanent basis under current law.  Additionally, our intellectual property is largely owned by our foreign subsidiaries, resulting in </span></div><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">39</span></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"></hr><div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><a style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;" href="#s566B28AC7F4D55EC973F7457E5A47EAB"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">Table of Contents</span></a></div></div><div><br/></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">proportionally higher earnings in jurisdictions with lower statutory tax rates, which decreases our overall effective tax rate.  </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">For the </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">three months ended</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">November 30, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">, income tax expense as a percentage of income before income tax was </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">10.3%</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> compared to </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">6.9%</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> for the same period last year.  The year-over-year increase in the effective tax rate is primarily due to shifts in the mix of taxable income in our various tax jurisdictions and increases in certain statutory tax rates.  </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">For the </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">nine months ended</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">November 30, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">, income tax expense as a percentage of income before income tax was </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">9.6%</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">, which included $1.0 million of tax benefits from share-based compensation settlements, </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">$1.7</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> million of expense from the remeasurement of deferred taxes due to tax rate changes, and a </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">$2.8</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> million benefit from the resolution of an uncertain tax position.  Income tax expense as a percentage of income before income tax was </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">7.2%</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> for the same period last year, which included </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">$0.7</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> million tax benefits from share-based compensation settlements and a </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">$0.8</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> million benefit from the lapse of the statute of limitations related to an uncertain tax position.  The year-over-year increase in the effective tax rate is primarily due to shifts in the mix of taxable income in our various tax jurisdictions, increases in certain statutory tax rates and the comparative impact of discrete benefits recorded in the same period last year.  </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">During fiscal 2017, we received an assessment from a state tax authority which adjusted taxable income applicable to the particular state resulting from interpretations of certain state income tax provisions applicable to our legal structure.&#160;&#160;We believe we have accurately reported our taxable income and are vigorously protesting the assessment through administrative processes with the state.&#160;&#160;We believe it is unlikely that the outcome of these matters will have a material adverse effect on our consolidated financial position, results of operations, or liquidity.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">Our Macau subsidiary generates income from the sale of the goods it has sourced and procured.  This subsidiary is responsible for the sourcing and procurement of a large portion of the products that we sell.  We currently have an indefinite tax holiday in Macau conditioned on the subsidiary meeting certain employment and investment thresholds.  The Macau Offshore Law and its supplementary regulations that grant tax incentives to approved offshore institutions will be abolished on January 1, 2021.  Existing approved offshore institutions such as ours can continue to operate under the offshore regime until the end of the calendar year 2020.  Beginning in calendar year 2021, we believe our Macau subsidiary will become subject to a statutory corporate income tax of approximately 12%.  The ultimate impact of this change, if any, on our overall effective tax rate will depend on a variety of factors including our mix of income by jurisdiction, transfer pricing considerations and the specific tax regulations applicable to us when we are no longer under the Macau Offshore regime.  It is not practicable for us to determine the potential impact on our financial statements until the tax changes in Macau are fully established and our transfer pricing analysis is complete.  Because our Macau subsidiary is not directly or indirectly owned by a U.S. parent, there is no U.S. tax liability associated with the income generated in Macau.  </span></div><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">40</span></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"></hr><div><a id="s3DDBEB06250A56138439E63E96A63569"></a></div><div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><a style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;" href="#s566B28AC7F4D55EC973F7457E5A47EAB"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">Table of Contents</span></a></div></div><div><br/></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Income from continuing operations, diluted EPS from continuing operations, adjusted income from continuing operations (non-GAAP), and adjusted diluted EPS from continuing operations (non-GAAP)</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">&#160;</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">In order to provide a better understanding of the impact of certain items on our income and EPS from continuing operations, the analysis that follows reports the comparative after tax impact of non-cash asset impairment charges, acquisition-related expenses, restructuring charges, amortization of intangible assets, and non-cash share</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#8208;</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">based compensation, as applicable, on income from continuing operations, and diluted EPS from continuing operations for the periods covered below.  For additional information regarding management&#8217;s decision to present this non-GAAP financial information, see the introduction to this Item 2, &#8220;Management&#8217;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations.&#8221; </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><div This was partially offset by higher income tax expense.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">Adjusted income from continuing operations </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">increased</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">$15.9 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">, or </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">25.2%</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">, to </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">$79.1 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">, compared to </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">$63.2 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> the same period last year.&#160;&#160;Adjusted diluted EPS from continuing operations </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">increased</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">30.0%</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> to </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">$3.12</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">, compared to </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">$2.40</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">.&#160;&#160;  </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;">Comparison of First </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;">Nine</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;"> Months of Fiscal </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;">2020</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;"> to First </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;">Nine</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;"> Months of Fiscal </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;">2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;"> </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">Income from continuing operations was </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">$155.5 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">, compared to </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">$136.5 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">.&#160;&#160;Diluted EPS from continuing operations was </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">$6.15</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">, compared to </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">$5.15</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">. Housewares segment and lower weighted average diluted shares outstanding compared to the same period last year</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">.  </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">This was partially offset by lower operating income in our Beauty segment, higher interest expense and higher income tax expense.</span></div><div measure.</span></div></td></tr></table><div style="line-height:120%;padding-left:4px;text-align:left;padding-left:24px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">We rely principally on cash flows from operations and borrowings under our credit facility to finance our operations, acquisitions, and capital expenditures.&#160;&#160;We believe our cash flows from operations and availability under our credit facility are sufficient to meet our working capital and capital expenditure needs.&#160;  </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">Operating Activities</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">Operating activities from continuing operations provided net cash of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">$101.4 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> for the </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">nine</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> months ended </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">November 30, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">, compared to </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">$109.5 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> for the same period last year.&#160;&#160;The decrease is primarily due to an increase in cash used for accounts receivable, accounts payable and accrued expenses and was partially offset by increased income from continuing operations. </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">Investing Activities</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">During the </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">nine months ended</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">November 30, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">, we invested in capital and intangible asset expenditures of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">$13.2 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">, compared to </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">$22.2 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> for the same period last year.  The decrease is primarily due to the comparative impact of leasehold improvement expenditures in the same period last year.  &#160;</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">Financing Activities </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">Financing activities from continuing operations used </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">$80.4 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> of cash during the </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">nine</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> months ended </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">November 30, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">, compared to </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">$84.8 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> for the same period last year.&#160;&#160;A reduction in repurchases of common stock was offset by higher net repayments on our line of credit for the first </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">nine</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> months of fiscal 2020 compared to the same period last year.  </span></div><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">43</span></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"></hr><div><a id="sCF552267E661591A854AD701348B4077"></a></div><div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><a style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;" href="#s566B28AC7F4D55EC973F7457E5A47EAB"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">Table of Contents</span></a></div></div><div><br/></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">Credit and Other Debt Agreements</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Credit Agreement</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">We have a credit agreement (the &#8220;Credit Agreement&#8221;) with Bank of America, N.A., as administrative agent, and other lenders that provides for an unsecured total revolving commitment of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">$1.0</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> billion as of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">November 30, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">.  The commitment under the Credit Agreement terminates and the Credit Agreement matures on December 7, 2021.  Borrowings accrue interest under one of two alternative methods (based on a base rate or LIBOR) as described in the Credit Agreement.  With each borrowing against our credit line, we can elect the interest rate method based on our funding needs at the time.  We also incur loan commitment and letter of credit fees under the Credit Agreement. Outstanding letters of credit reduce the borrowing availability under the Credit Agreement on a dollar-for-dollar basis.  As of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">November 30, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">, the outstanding revolving loan principal balance was </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">$225.8 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> (excluding prepaid financing fees) and the balance of outstanding letters of credit was </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">$9.0 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">.  As of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">November 30, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">, the amount available for borrowings under the Credit Agreement was </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">$765.2 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">.  Covenants in our debt agreements limit the amount of total indebtedness we can incur.&#160;&#160;As of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">November 30, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">, these covenants effectively limited our ability to incur more than </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">$730.5 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> of additional debt from all sources, including our Credit Agreement, or </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">$765.2 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> in the event a qualified acquisition is consummated.&#160;</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Other Debt Agreements</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">We have an aggregate principal balance of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">$20.5 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">&#160;(excluding prepaid financing fees) under a loan agreement with the Mississippi Business Finance Corporation (the &#8220;MBFC Loan&#8221;) as of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">November 30, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">.  The borrowings were used to fund construction of our Olive Branch, Mississippi distribution facility.  Since March 2018, the MBFC Loan can be called by the holder at any time.  The remaining loan balance is payable as follows: </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">$1.9 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> annually on March 1, 2020 through 2022; and </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">$14.8 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> on March 1, 2023.  Any remaining outstanding principal and interest is due upon maturity on March 1, 2023.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">All of our debt is unconditionally guaranteed, on a joint and several basis, by the Company and certain of its subsidiaries.  Our debt agreements require the maintenance of certain key financial covenants, defined in the table below.  Our debt agreements also contain other customary covenants, including, among other things, covenants restricting or limiting us, except under certain conditions set forth therein, from (1) incurring debt, (2) incurring liens on our properties, (3) making certain types of investments, (4) selling certain assets or making other fundamental changes relating to mergers and consolidations, and (5) repurchasing shares of our common stock and paying dividends.  Our debt agreements also contain customary events of default, including failure to pay principal or interest when due, among others.  Our debt agreements are cross-defaulted to each other.  Upon an event of default under our debt agreements, the holders or lenders may, among other things, accelerate the maturity of any amounts outstanding under our debt agreements.  The commitments of the lenders to make loans to us under the Credit Agreement are several and not joint.  Accordingly, if any lender fails to make loans to us, our available liquidity could be reduced by an amount up to the aggregate amount of such lender&#8217;s commitments under the Credit Agreement.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"><br/></span></div><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Earnings Before Non-Cash Charges, Interest Expense and Taxes</span></div><div Depreciation and Amortization Expense + Share-based Compensation</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">Pro Forma Effect of Acquisitions:&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;For any acquisition, pre-acquisition EBITDA of the acquired business is included so that the </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-left:192px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">EBITDA of the acquired business included in the computation equals its twelve month trailing total.  </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:underline;">Notes:</span></div><div special purpose entities or off-balance sheet financing.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Current and Future Capital Needs</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">Based on our current financial condition and current operations, we believe that cash flows from operations and available financing sources will continue to provide sufficient capital resources to fund our foreseeable short- and long-term liquidity requirements, including our pending acquisition of Drybar Products LLC.  Other than the Drybar Products LLC acquisition, we expect our capital needs to stem primarily from the need to purchase sufficient levels of inventory and to carry normal levels of accounts receivable on our balance sheet. In addition, we continue to evaluate acquisition opportunities on a regular basis.  We may finance acquisition activity with available cash, the issuance of shares of common stock, additional debt, or other sources of financing, depending upon the size and nature of any such transaction and the status of the capital markets at the time of such acquisition.  We may also elect to repurchase additional shares of common stock under our Board authorization, subject to limitations contained in our debt agreements and based upon our assessment of a number of factors, including share price, trading volume and general market conditions, working capital requirements, general business conditions, financial conditions, any applicable contractual limitations, and other factors, including alternative investment opportunities.  We may finance share repurchases with available cash, additional debt or other sources of financing.  For additional information, see Part II, Item 5, &#8220;Market for Registrant&#8217;s Common Equity, Related Shareholder Matters and Issuer Purchases of Equity Securities&#8221; in our latest annual report on form 10-K and Part II, Item 2, "Unregistered Sales of Equity Securities and </span></div><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">45</span></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"></hr><div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><a style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;" href="#s566B28AC7F4D55EC973F7457E5A47EAB"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">Table of Contents</span></a></div></div><div><br/></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">Use of Proceeds" in this report.
