QUANTITATIVE AND QUALITATIVE DISCLOSURES ABOUT MARKET RISK</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">There have been no material changes in the information provided in the section entitled &#8220;Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures about Market Risk&#8221; in our Form 10-K.&#160;&#160;Additional information regarding risk management activities can be found in Notes </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">12</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">, </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">13</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> and </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">14</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> to the accompanying condensed consolidated financial statements.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"><br/></span></div><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">47</span></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"></hr><div><a id="s17CCB3E7FDF25A1B90099A1AF4B23C97"></a></div><div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><a style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;" href="#s566B28AC7F4D55EC973F7457E5A47EAB"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">Table of Contents</span></a></div></div><div><br/></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">ITEM 4. CONTROLS AND PROCEDURES</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">DISCLOSURE CONTROLS AND PROCEDURES</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">Our management, under the supervision and with the participation of our Chief Executive Officer (&#8220;CEO&#8221;) and Chief Financial Officer (&#8220;CFO&#8221;), maintains disclosure controls and procedures as defined in Rules&#160;13a-15(e) under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 ("Exchange Act") that are designed to provide reasonable assurance that information required to be disclosed in the reports that we file or submit under the Exchange Act is recorded, processed, summarized, and reported within the time periods specified in the SEC&#8217;s rules&#160;and forms, and that such information is accumulated and communicated to management, including the CEO and CFO, as appropriate to allow timely decisions regarding required disclosures.  Because of inherent limitations, disclosure controls and procedures, no matter how well designed and operated, can provide only reasonable, and not absolute, assurance that the objectives of disclosure controls and procedures are met.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">Our management, including our CEO and CFO, has evaluated the effectiveness of our disclosure controls and procedures as of the end of the fiscal quarter ended </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">November 30, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">.  Based upon that evaluation, the CEO and CFO concluded that our disclosure controls and procedures were effective at a reasonable level of assurance as of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">November 30, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">, the end of the period covered by this quarterly report on Form&#160;10-Q.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">CHANGES IN INTERNAL CONTROL OVER FINANCIAL REPORTING</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">In connection with the evaluation described above, we identified no change in our internal control over financial reporting as defined in Rule&#160;13a-15(f)&#160;of the Exchange Act that occurred during our fiscal quarter ended </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">November 30, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">, that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, our internal control over financial reporting.  </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"><br/></span></div><div><a id="s53A544A54A095134A256D035814EF10E"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:underline;">PART&#160;II. OTHER INFORMATION</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div><a id="sEE86EF5EE00957C6A39CE15E16839383"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">ITEM 1. LEGAL PROCEEDINGS</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">&#160;</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">We are involved in various legal claims and proceedings in the normal course of operations.  We believe the outcome of these matters will not have a material adverse effect on our consolidated financial position, results of operations or liquidity.&#160;&#160;</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"><br/></span></div><div><a id="s86DC5C7AB9DA5E1782B78523D1C17E7B"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">ITEM 1A. RISK FACTORS &#160;</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">The ownership of our common stock involves a number of risks and uncertainties.  When evaluating the Company and our business before making an investment decision regarding our securities, potential investors should carefully consider the risk factors and uncertainties described in Part 1, Item 1A. &#8220;Risk Factors&#8221; of our annual report on Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended February 28, 2019.&#160;&#160;Since the filing of our annual report on Form 10-K, there have been no material changes in our risk factors from those disclosed therein.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"><br/></span></div><div><a id="s410E09F9A11853A4B015FC45F836BDC0"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">ITEM 2. UNREGISTERED SALES OF EQUITY SECURITIES AND USE OF PROCEEDS &#160;</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">On May 8, 2019, our Board of Directors authorized the repurchase of up to $400 million of our outstanding common stock.  The authorization is effective until May 2022 and replaced our former repurchase authorization, of which $107.4 million was outstanding at the time the new authorization was approved.  These repurchases may include open market purchases, privately negotiated transactions, block trades, accelerated stock repurchase transactions, or any combination of such methods.  The </span></div><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">48</span></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"></hr><div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><a style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;" href="#s566B28AC7F4D55EC973F7457E5A47EAB"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">Table of Contents</span></a></div></div><div><br/></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">number of shares purchased and the timing of the purchases will depend on a number of factors, including share price, trading volume and general market conditions, working capital requirements, general business conditions, financial conditions, any applicable contractual limitations, and other factors, including alternative investment opportunities.  See </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">Note 9</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"> to the accompanying condensed consolidated financial statements for additional information.  </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">Our current equity-based compensation plans include provisions that allow for the "net exercise" of share settled awards by all plan participants.  In a net exercise, any required payroll taxes, federal withholding taxes and exercise price of the shares due from the option or other share-based award holders are settled by having the holder tender back to us a number of shares at fair value equal to the amounts due.  Net exercises are treated as purchases and retirements of shares.  </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">The following table summarizes our share repurchase activity for the periods shown:</span></div><div
